title.narrative: Enhancing Migration Management in Ethiopia and Promoting Voluntary Return and Reintegration of Ethiopians, engagement

description.narrative: Voluntary return and reintegration and ensuring the sustainability of return through tailored reintegration support, addressing root causes of irregular and secondary migration, improving migration management and coordination in Ethiopia.
FL §06.32.08.60 Stabilisation and Conflict Prevention

title.narrative: Outcome 3: Stakeholders involved in migration management in Ethiopia coordinate their interventions better and have increased capacity.

description.narrative: % increase in VoTs/vulnerable migrants seeking protection through the NRM/NoVASP

title.narrative: Outcome 3: Stakeholders involved in migration management in Ethiopia coordinate their interventions better and have increased capacity.

description.narrative: % increase in VoTs/vulnerable migrants seeking protection through the NRM/NoVASP

comment.narrative: % of Anti-TIP/SoM Taskforce coordination offices who are actively monitoring and leading the implementation of the Anti-TIP/SoM National Plan of Action.

title.narrative: Outcome 1: Ethiopian migrants have returned from their host country, including from Denmark, and are empowered through tailored re-integration assistance

description.narrative: % of migrants who have effectively implemented their reintegration plans with support from IOM and partners through referrals.

title.narrative: Outcome 1: Ethiopian migrants have returned from their host country, including from Denmark, and are empowered through tailored re-integration assistance

description.narrative: % of migrants who have effectively implemented their reintegration plans with support from IOM and partners through referrals.

comment.narrative: % of migrants who have effectively implemented their reintegration plans with support from IOM and partners through referrals.

title.narrative: Output 1.1: # of returnees provided with need-based psychosocial and socio-economic reintegration support (sex-disaggregated data).

description.narrative: Ethiopian vulnerable migrants (including unsuccessful asylum seekers in Denmark) who have returned to Ethiopia are provided with post-arrival assistance and tailored reintegration support.

title.narrative: Output 1.1: # of returnees provided with need-based psychosocial and socio-economic reintegration support (sex-disaggregated data).

description.narrative: Ethiopian vulnerable migrants (including unsuccessful asylum seekers in Denmark) who have returned to Ethiopia are provided with post-arrival assistance and tailored reintegration support.

comment.narrative: # of returnees provided with need-based psychosocial and socio-economic reintegration support (sex-disaggregated data).

title.narrative: Output 2.4: # of sensitization workshops held at federal and regional states level.

description.narrative: Local private sector actors are sensitized on issues related to irregular migration and human trafficking and the challenges faced by victims and returnees and the role they can play in responding to the issues.

title.narrative: Output 2.4: # of sensitization workshops held at federal and regional states level.

description.narrative: Local private sector actors are sensitized on issues related to irregular migration and human trafficking and the challenges faced by victims and returnees and the role they can play in responding to the issues.

comment.narrative: # of sensitization workshops held at federal and regional states level.

title.narrative: Output 2.1: # of vulnerable community members, of whom 50% are female, provided with livelihood support and managed to implement their individual livelihoods plans.

description.narrative: Members of communities at risk of irregular migration/trafficking are provided with tailored livelihood support.

title.narrative: Output 2.1: # of vulnerable community members, of whom 50% are female, provided with livelihood support and managed to implement their individual livelihoods plans.

description.narrative: Members of communities at risk of irregular migration/trafficking are provided with tailored livelihood support.

comment.narrative: # of vulnerable community members, of whom 50% are female, provided with livelihood support and managed to implement their individual livelihoods plans.

title.narrative: Output 3.3: # of law enforcement officers, judges and prosecutors trained on Victim-Centred Investigation Techniques, protection standards for Victims of Trafficking and new components brought by Proclamation 909/2015.

description.narrative: The Ethiopian law enforcement and judiciary have improved capacity to investigate and prosecute TiP/SoM crimes and to protect victims.

title.narrative: Output 3.3: # of law enforcement officers, judges and prosecutors trained on Victim-Centred Investigation Techniques, protection standards for Victims of Trafficking and new components brought by Proclamation 909/2015.

description.narrative: The Ethiopian law enforcement and judiciary have improved capacity to investigate and prosecute TiP/SoM crimes and to protect victims.

comment.narrative: # of law enforcement officers, judges and prosecutors trained on Victim-Centred Investigation Techniques, protection standards for Victims of Trafficking and new components brought by Proclamation 909/2015.

title.narrative: Output 3.2: # of national and regional taskforce members who received migration management capacity building support in the form of International Migration Law training and study tour to Denmark.

description.narrative: The National Anti-TiP and SoM Taskforce and its regional and local structures have increased capacity to implement the Anti-Trafficking and Smuggling National Plan of Action (NPA).

title.narrative: Output 3.2: # of national and regional taskforce members who received migration management capacity building support in the form of International Migration Law training and study tour to Denmark.

description.narrative: The National Anti-TiP and SoM Taskforce and its regional and local structures have increased capacity to implement the Anti-Trafficking and Smuggling National Plan of Action (NPA).

comment.narrative: # of national and regional taskforce members who received migration management capacity building support in the form of International Migration Law training and study tour to Denmark.

title.narrative: Output 3.1: # of trainings of NRM/NoVASP members as well as health practitioners on VoT screening, identification and referral and minimum protection standards for returnees including victims of trafficking and on care specific to Victims of Trafficking.

description.narrative: The Network of Victim Assistance Service Providers (NoVASP) and National Referral Mechanism (NRM) are operational and their capacity is further built to allow for enhanced assistance to returnees.

title.narrative: Output 3.1: # of trainings of NRM/NoVASP members as well as health practitioners on VoT screening, identification and referral and minimum protection standards for returnees including victims of trafficking and on care specific to Victims of Trafficking.

description.narrative: The Network of Victim Assistance Service Providers (NoVASP) and National Referral Mechanism (NRM) are operational and their capacity is further built to allow for enhanced assistance to returnees.

comment.narrative: # of trainings of NRM/NoVASP members as well as health practitioners on VoT screening, identification and referral and minimum protection standards for returnees including victims of trafficking and on care specific to Victims of Trafficking on federal + regional level

title.narrative: Output 2.3: Presence of a shelter that provides rehabilitation support to male victims of trafficking.

description.narrative: The capacity building needs of local Government offices and NGOs engaged in migration management and particularly rehabilitation, reintegration, and livelihoods support in the targeted areas are identified and their capacity is built accordingly.

title.narrative: Output 2.3: Presence of a shelter that provides rehabilitation support to male victims of trafficking.

description.narrative: The capacity building needs of local Government offices and NGOs engaged in migration management and particularly rehabilitation, reintegration, and livelihoods support in the targeted areas are identified and their capacity is built accordingly.

comment.narrative: Presence of a shelter that provides rehabilitation support to male victims of trafficking.

title.narrative: Outcome 2: % of potential migrants provided with livelihood support who report reduced economic vulnerability that impels them to migrate irregularly.

description.narrative: Vulnerable youth in irregular migration prone communities have access to alternative livelihoods options and are encouraged to invest their energy and resources at home in a youth friendly environment.

title.narrative: Outcome 2: % of potential migrants provided with livelihood support who report reduced economic vulnerability that impels them to migrate irregularly.

description.narrative: Vulnerable youth in irregular migration prone communities have access to alternative livelihoods options and are encouraged to invest their energy and resources at home in a youth friendly environment.

comment.narrative: % of potential migrants provided with livelihood support who report reduced economic vulnerability that impels them to migrate irregularly.

title.narrative: Output 2.2: # of youth centres equipped with educational and entertainment materials, as per outcomes of the needs assessment.

description.narrative: Youth in the target zones have access to an increased range of educational and recreational activities and their awareness on the risks involved in irregular migration is increased.
